intro: Calostigma dusenii, commonly known as the Dusen's goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Calostigma dusenii is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, thriving in full sun. Its botanical structure supports its adaptation to harsh, dry climates, making it a resilient species in its native range.
